top_categories.workout_context: Iron Horse Bicycle Classic’s colorado mountains, mixed surfaces demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Iron Horse Bicycle Classic rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Iron Horse Bicycle Classic’s colorado mountain mixed terrain and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Racing Iron Horse Bicycle Classic isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Iron Horse Bicycle Classic when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Iron Horse Bicycle Classic. Make this intensity feel like home.
Iron Horse Bicycle Classic’s 6,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Iron Horse Bicycle Classic — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Iron Horse Bicycle Classic’s colorado mountain mixed terrain drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Iron Horse Bicycle Classic’s 6,000ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Iron Horse Bicycle Classic — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on colorado mountain mixed terrain.
Every session at Iron Horse Bicycle Classic intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Iron Horse Bicycle Classic’s 65 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Iron Horse Bicycle Classic. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Iron Horse Bicycle Classic requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on colorado mountain mixed terrain to build confidence. Expect: colorado mountains, mixed surfaces, mountain gravel.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, TT Threshold, and VO2max to prepare you for 65 miles of colorado mountain mixed terrain in Durango, Colorado.
